Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Impossible! Where are you?!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: I am here with the bird and I will bring it back and then you will like me. Oh, gotta go. On the collar screen, the dogs get a fleeting glimpse of a boy's face. It's Russell.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey Dug! Who you talking to?

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: What's Dug doing?

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: Why's he with that small mailman?

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: There he is. Come on!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh please oh please oh PLEASE be my prisoner!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Dug, stop bothering Kevin!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: That man there says I can take the bird and I love that man there like he is my master.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I am not your master!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: I am warning you, once again, bird!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey!     Quit it!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: I am jumping on you now, bird.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell! At this rate we'll never get to the falls!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I am nobody's master, got it?  I'm stuck with you. And if you two don't clear out of here by the time I count to three- Dug sees the tennis balls on Carl's cane.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: A ball!   Oh boy oh boy!     A ball!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Ball? Carl pops off one of the tennis balls.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: You want it boy?     Huh?   Huh?   Yeah?

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh oh oh! Yes, I do.        I do ever so want the ball!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Go get it!! Carl throws the ball far away.    Dug chases after it.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh boy, oh boy! I will get it and then bring it back!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Quick Russell, give me some chocolate.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Just give it to me! Carl grabs some chocolate and waves it at the bird.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Bird.   Bird! Carl THROWS the chocolate.     The bird runs after it.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: C'mon Russell!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Wait.   Wait, Mr. Fredricksen.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Daah!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Aaahh...

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: What are we doing?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey, uh, we're pretty far now. Kevin's gonna miss me.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I think that did the trick.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Hi, Master.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Afternoon. Carl turns the other way.       The bird.   It HONKS at him.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Well, thanks for keeping us dry anyway, Ellie.  RUSSELL  Which one's the front?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Is this step three, or step five? Carl ROLLS HIS EYES at Russell's ineptness.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: There! Russell struggles with a tent pole, trying to winch it into place.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: All done. Russell turns, revealing a large RED WELT on his face.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That's for you!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Awh.   Tents are hard.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wait, aren't you "Super Wilderness Guy?" With the GPM's and the badges?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yeah, but... can I tell you a secret?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Alright, here goes. I never actually built a tent before. There. I said it.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: You've been camping before, haven't you?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Well, never outside.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Well, why didn't you ask your Dad how to build a tent?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I don't think he wants to talk about this stuff.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Why don't you try him sometime? Maybe he'll surprise you.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Well, he's away a lot.   I don't see him much.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: He's got to be home sometime.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Well, I called, but Phyllis told me I bug him too much.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Phyllis? You call your own mother by her first name?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Phyllis isn't my mom. Carl realizes he put his foot in it.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: But he promised he'd come to my Explorer ceremony to pin on my Assisting the Elderly badge, so he can show me about tents then, right?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Hey, uh, why don't you get some sleep. Don't want to wake up the traveling flea circus.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Mr. Fredricksen, Dug says he wants to take Kevin prisoner. We have to protect him!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Can Kevin go with us?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Alright.   He can come.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Promise you won't leave him?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Cross your heart?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Cross my heart.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: What have I got myself into, Ellie?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Morning Sweetheart.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: We better get moving.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Huh. Bird's gone. Maybe Russell won't notice.  Alright, everybody up!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Where's Kevin? He's wandered off! Kevin! Dug, find Kevin!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Find the bird.    Find the bird...

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Oh, look! There he is.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: POINT! The bird has gathered a pile of food on Carl's roof.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Hey, that's my food!   Get off my roof!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Yeah, get off of his <>!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: What is it doing?

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: The bird is calling to her babies.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Her babies! Kevin's a girl? The bird gobbles the food and jumps off the roof.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Her house is over there in those twisty rocks. Miles off is a huge grouping of rocks; the LABYRINTH.   The baby birds call from somewhere inside.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: She has been gathering food for her babies and must get back to them.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Wait, Kevin's just leaving? But you promised to protect her!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Her babies need her, we gotta make sure they're together.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Sorry Russell. We've lost enough time already.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: This was her favorite chocolate. Because you sent her away, there's more for you. Carl rolls his eyes and SIGHS.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Kevin?

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Where's the bird? You said you had the bird.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh, yes. Oh, yes. Since I have said that, I can see how you would think that.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Uh, tomorrow. Come back tomorrow and then I will again have the bird. Yes.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: You lost it. Why do I not have a surprised feeling? Well, at least you now have lead us to the small mailman and The One Who Smells of Prunes.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Master will be most pleased we have found them, and will ask of them many questions.  Come!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wait, we're not going with you. We're going to the falls! Gamma and Beta BARK fiercely at Carl.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Get away from me! Get down!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You came here in that?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Uh... yeah.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: In a house? A floating house? The man laughs.   Carl and Russell laugh along nervously.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: That is the darndest thing I've ever seen! You're not after my bird, are you? But if you need to borrow a cup of sugar, I'd be happy to oblige! The dogs LAUGH uproariously at the man's joke.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Well, this is all a misunderstanding. My dogs made a mistake.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wait, are you Charles Muntz?!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Well... Yes.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: The Charles Muntz?

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: "Adventure is out there!"

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: It's really him!  That's Charles Muntz!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Him!

Speaker: dog walla
Dialogue: Yes!    It is him! He is!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I'm Carl Fredricksen. My wife and I, we were your biggest fans!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Well, you're a man of good taste!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: You must be tired.     Hungry?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Uh-huh.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Attention everyone! These people are no longer intruders. They are our guests.

Speaker: dog walla
Dialogue: Follow me! I like you temporarily. You do smell like prunes. I will not bite you.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Go ahead and moor your airship right next to mine.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: We're not actually going inside the "Spirit of Adventure" itself?!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh.    Would you like to?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Would I?!?!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wait up, Mr. Muntz!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Jiminy Cricket.

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Not you.

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: What do we do with Dug?

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: He has lost the bird.     Put him in the Cone of Shame.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: I do not like the Cone of Shame.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Most of the collection is housed in the world's top museums: New York, Munich, London... `Course I kept the best for myself.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Did you ever! Will you look at that?

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh yes, the Arsinoitherium. Beast charged while I was brushing my teeth. Used my shaving kit to bring him down. A dog approaches carrying a menu.    Muntz waves it off.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh, surprise me.  Only way to get it out of Ethiopia at the time was to have it declared as "dental equipment!" Muntz LAUGHS.   Behind him, a dog can't resist gnawing at one of the bones.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Oh my gosh, the Giant Somalian Leopard Tortoise!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh, you recognize it? I'm impressed! That's an interesting story there...

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Hm, excellent choice.  I found it on safari with Roosevelt. Two dogs work together to remove the cork from the bottle. POP! They sloppily pour two glasses.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: He and I fell into a habit of playing gin rummy in the evenings. And did he cheat? Oh, he was horrible!

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Master, dinner is ready.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh dear, broken translator.   It's that loose wire again.  There you go big fella.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Thank you Master. Russell reacts.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I liked his other voice. Muntz LAUGHS.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Well, dinner is served!    Right this way.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: So how are things stateside? Almost tempted to go back a few times, but I have unfinished work here... Please. Dogs pull back chairs for them.   They sit.   Dog waiters place napkins on their laps.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: I hope you're hungry because Epsilon is the finest chef I've ever had. Dogs bring out covered plates, look at each other, and remove the silver plate covers at the same time. The meals look delicious.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh, Epsilon, you've done it again!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yes!! Russell is served a hot dog.   His waiter can't resist and eats a bite.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Oh my Ellie would have loved all this. You know, it's because of you she had this dream to come down here and live by Paradise Falls.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: I'm honored. And now you've made it!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: You're sure we're not a bother? I'd hate to impose.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: No no! It's a pleasure to have guests -- a real treat.

Speaker: dog walla
Dialogue: Treat?!   Treat! I want a treat!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: No no, quiet! Calm down.     Calm down... In the excitement a dog swipes the rest of Russell's hot dog.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: They called me a fraud, those... dah! But once I bring back this creature, my name will be cleared. The lantern illuminates photographs, drawings, samples, feathers. Hundreds of them... all of THE BIRD. Kevin.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Beautiful, isn't it? I've spent a lifetime tracking it. Sometimes years go by between sightings...
MUNTZ  I've tried to smoke it out of that deathly labyrinth where it lives... Can't go in after it. Once in, there's no way out. Lost so many dogs... Muntz is lost in reverie.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: And here they come, these bandits, and think the bird is theirs to take! But they soon find that this mountain is a very dangerous place.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey, that looks like Kevin!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: "Kevin?"

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yeah! That's my new giant bird pet. I trained it to follow us.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Follow you? Impossible.      How?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: She likes chocolate.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Chocolate?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yeah, I gave her some of my chocolate. She goes ga-ga for it.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: But it ran off!      It's gone now.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: You know, Carl. These people who pass through here, they all tell pretty good stories. A "Surveyor" making a map. Using his cane, Muntz topples a helmet from the table.   It rolls across the floor.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: A "Botanist" cataloguing plants.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: An old man taking his house to Paradise Falls.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: That's the best one yet. I can't wait to hear how it ends. Carl glances around nervously.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Well! It's been a wonderful evening, but we'd better be going.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh, you're not leaving?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: We don't want to take advantage of your hospitality. Come on Russell.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: But we haven't even had dessert yet.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: No, the boy's right. You haven't had dessert. Epsilon here makes a delicious Cherries Jubilee.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Oh, you really must stay. I insist! We have so much more to talk about!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Kevin? Muntz walks to the window and looks out.          Atop the roof he sees THE BIRD.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: It's here. He turns back to Carl... but they're gone.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Get them!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Hurry!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I am hurrying!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: They're coming!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Go toward the light, master! Dogs climb down the rocks, closing in on Carl and Russell.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Get back!! Alpha is about to bite when an avalanche of boulders rains down! The dogs stop short.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Go on Master!       I will stop the dogs! Dug jumps down to block the path of the approaching dogs.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Stop you dogs!!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Help! Help!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Gimme your hand! Carl holds out his cane so that Russell can GRAB it and Carl PULLS him back onto the bird. Meanwhile Dug manages to rejoin his friends, but just in time to reach the end of the line -- A CLIFF EDGE.   A river winds 100 feet below.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hang on to Kevin!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: No no no! Kevin! Stay down.  She's hurt real bad. Can't we help her get home?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Alright.   But we've got to hurry.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: You lost them?

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Uh, it was Dug.

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: Yeah, he's with them.    He helped them escape!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Wait.   Wait a minute.   Dug...

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: See anything?

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: No, my pack is not following us! Boy they are dumb. Dug scampers back to Carl and Russell, who pull the house from behind a tree canopy.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: This is crazy. I finally meet my childhood hero and he's trying to kill us! What a joke.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Hey, I know a joke. A squirrel walks up to a tree and says I forgot to store acorns for winter and now I am dead. Ha! It is funny because the squirrel gets dead. They pull the house, keeping it hidden behind the trees.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Careful Russell. The house bumps into a tree, jostling the injured BIRD on the porch.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: You okay, Kevin? Kevin goes back to sleep.    Russell looks at her BANDAGED LEG.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: You know what, Mr. Fredricksen? The wilderness isn't quite what I expected.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Yeah?   How so?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: It's kinda... wild. I mean, it's not how they made it sound in my book.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Hmm, get used to that, kid.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: My dad made it sound so easy. He's really good at camping, and how to make fire from rocks and stuff. He used to come to all my Sweatlodge meetings.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: And afterwards we'd go get ice cream at Fentons. I always get chocolate and he gets butter- brickle. Then we'd sit on this one curb, right outside, and I'll count all the blue cars and he counts all the red ones, and whoever gets the most, wins. I like that curb. He looks up at Carl.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That might sound boring, but I think the boring stuff is the stuff I remember the most. They walk in silence.   Carl understands.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Look, there it is!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Hold on Russell, stand still!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Look at that bird go!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wait up, you overgrown chicken!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That's it, go Kevin!      Go find your babies!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Run Kevin! Run!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Oh no!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell, give me your knife!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: No! Carl pulls his house away from the flames.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Careful. We want her in good shape for my return.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Let her go! Stop!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Kevin! Carl beats out the flames with his jacket.     He extinguishes the flames.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: You gave away Kevin.   You just gave her away.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: This is none of my concern.      I didn't ask for any of this!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Master.   It's alright.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I am not your master! And if you hadn't a shown up, none of this would have happened! Bad dog! Bad dog!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Now, whether you assist me or not, I am going to Paradise Falls if it kills me.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I don't want this anymore. Russell walks away.   He sits on a rock, alone.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I'm gonna help Kevin even if you won't!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No, Russell! No! Carl runs back to his house and tries in desperation to lift it. He struggles, but the house doesn't budge. The balloons have lost too much helium.

Speaker: cut to:
Dialogue: The GRAMOPHONE smashes onto the rocky ground. Chairs, dressers, tables; Carl throws them all out of the house.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Wahhoo!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Dug!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: I was hiding under your porch because I love you. Can I stay?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Can you stay? Well, you're my dog aren't you? And I'm your master!

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: You are my master?! Dug lunges forward and overwhelms Carl with dog kisses.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh boy.     Oh boy!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Ooph!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Yes!    Don't worry Kevin! I'll save - Growling dogs move toward him.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: And they wouldn't believe me. Just wait till they get a look at you.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Master! The small mailman has returned.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Let me go!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Where's your elderly friend?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: He's not my friend anymore.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Well, if you're here, Fredricksen can't be far behind.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Where are you keeping Kevin!?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Let me go!

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Scream all you want, small mailman.

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: None of your mailman friends can hear you.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I'll unleash all my Wilderness Explorer training!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Alpha! Fredricksen's coming back. Guard that bird. If you see the old man, you know what to do.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Hey, where are you going?    I'm not finished with you!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Nice talking with you.

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Where are you, Fredricksen?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell! Carl steers his house to the dirigible.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Mr. Fredricksen!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Dug!   Bring `er over! Dug winches in the hose caddy, pulling the house closer to the dirigible ramp.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: You came back for Kevin!     Let's go get her.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I'm getting Kevin.    You stay here!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: But I want to help!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I don't want your help.     I want you safe! Carl leaps back into the dirigible.    Dug follows.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: How do we get past these dogs?

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Uh... POINT! Dug points to a grate in the wall.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Kevin!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Don't worry Kevin, we're on our way! Alpha enters, leading a group of dogs. Carl and Dug duck into the shadows and watch unnoticed from above.

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: Allow no one to be entering through these doors. Guard well that bird, my minions.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: What do we do now, Dug?

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Who wants the ball?

Speaker: dogs
Dialogue: Me! I do! I want the ball!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Then go get it! Carl throws the ball.    The dogs scramble after it.

Speaker: dogs
Dialogue: I'm gonna get there first! Oh gonna get the ball! I'm gonna get it!

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: I got it!!

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: Uh-oh.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I'm sorry Kevin.      Let's get you out of here.

Speaker: dog walla
Dialogue: Master! He's gone! The old man! He's here! He's got the bird! The bird's gone!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: What?    Calm down!   One at a time!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I want to help! He manages to get his arms free.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Ha ha!

Speaker: dog walla
Dialogue: He's in Hall D! He's in Hall B! It's the old man!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Does anyone know where they are?!?!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Whoooaaah!

Speaker: muntz
Dialogue: Grey leader! Take down the house!

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Grey leader, checking in.

Speaker: gamma
Dialogue: Grey 2, checking in.

Speaker: omega
Dialogue: Grey 3, checking in. The planes fall into formation and fly toward the house.

Speaker: beta
Dialogue: Target sighted. The Dog Squadron Leader bites down on a squeaky bone chew toy that fires poison darts.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Come on, Kevin.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Hi.

Dialogue: Any last words, Fredricksen?   Come on, spit it out! Carl spits his FALSE TEETH at Muntz.    He falls backwards.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Come on!

Dialogue: Enough! I'm taking that bird back with me alive or dead! Carl trips and falls to the floor.     Muntz is about to deal the final blow.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Come on, Kevin!

Speaker: alpha
Dialogue: I will have many enjoyments for what I am about to do, Dug.

Dialogue: He wears the Cone of Shame!

Dialogue: What? Do not just continue sitting! Attack!

Dialogue: No! No! Stop your laughing! Get this off of me!

Dialogue: Listen you dog!     Sit! Surprised at Dug's moxy, Alpha sits.    All other dogs sit too.

Dialogue: Yes, Alpha.

Dialogue: Alpha? I am not Alpha, he is-   Oohhhh!

Dialogue: I can't do it!

Dialogue: Russell!

Dialogue: Huh?

Dialogue: You leave Mr. Fredricksen alone!

Dialogue: Hey!  Squirrel!

Dialogue: Squirrel?

Dialogue: Where's the squirrel?!

Dialogue: I hate squirrels.

Dialogue: Dug! Dug jumps up on Carl, licking his face.

Dialogue: Master! The house bears down on them.    They run to meet it.

Dialogue: Russell!! Over here!!    Let's go!

Dialogue: Mr. Fredricksen!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Come on, Kevin! Carl helps Dug onto the porch.   He climbs up himself...

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell!   Get out of there! Russell, Dug and Kevin run toward the front porch.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No!    Leave them alone!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell! Hang on to Kevin! Don't let go of her!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Kevin!   Chocolate!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That was cool! Russell and Dug dangle from it, sitting on Kevin.     The bird holds on to the hose with her beak. Carl LAUGHS, relieved.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Don't jerk around so much, kid! Russell climbs up, followed by the bird and Dug.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Oh I am ready to not be up high. Carl LAUGHS heartily as Dug jumps on him and licks his face. Carl looks into the distance. His house, now empty, floats softly down into the clouds, and disappears.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Sorry about your house, Mr. Fredricksen.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: You know, it's just a house. Carl, Russell, Dug and Kevin stand on the tail of the airship floating off over the clouds.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Ow! Ow! Ow!

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Look at you. You're so soft.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: I wish I could keep one.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Huh, where's my cane?      I just had it here... Kevin starts HACKING.    She COUGHS up the cane.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: You know what? Keep `em.       A little gift from me to you. The bird family enters the labyrinth.     Carl and Russell wave.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Bye Kevin! The bird looks back toward Carl and Russell and CALLS OUT one last time before disappearing into the mist.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Ready? Carl gives a thumbs up.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Ready!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: I'm here for him.  CAMP MASTER STRAUCH Congratulations, Russell. Sir...

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Russell, for assisting the elderly, and for performing above and beyond the call of duty, I would like to award you the highest honor I can bestow: The Ellie Badge.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Blue one.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Red one.

Speaker: dug
Dialogue: Grey one.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Red one.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That's a bike!

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: It's red, isn't it?

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: Mr. Fredricksen, you're cheating.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: No, I'm not. Red one.

Speaker: russell
Dialogue: That's a fire hydrant.

Speaker: carl
Dialogue: Maybe I need new glasses.
